Data elements¶

Region of Interest (ROI)¶

class data_elements.roi.Roi(name=None, volume=None, contours=None, msk=None)¶

Region of interest (ROI) class. Defines parameters and functions that relate to ROIs.

add_contour(*args)¶

Add a contour to the current ROI. By convention, contour points should be listed in counter-clockwise order. The exception is for ring structures (any ROIs with holes), in which case the inner contours should be clockwise

check_contour_directions()¶

Check the direction of all ROI contours.

By convention, contour points should be listed in counter-clockwise order. The exception is for ring structures (any ROIs with holes), in which case the inner contours should be clockwise

compute_edt(msk=None, limits=None)¶

Compute the Euclidean distance transform for the given ROI binary mask.

Keyword arguments:
msK:edge mask
limits:
count_mask_edge_voxels(mask=None, exclude_z=False)¶

Compute the number of voxels on the surface of the mask.

Keyword arguments:
mask:mask to compute over
exclude_z:boolean value. If True, only edges in the x-y plane are computed.
get_contour_planes()¶

Get a sorted list of unique contour planes

get_edge_mask(mask=None)¶

Compute the mask containing voxels only on the surface of the mask.

Keyword arguments:
mask:mask to compute over
get_edge_weighted_mask(template=None, size=None, spacing=None, radius=0.0, map_points_to_voxels=False)¶

Computes the binary mask with weighted edge voxels.

Keyword arguments:
template:image template can be used to specify image meta-data (image size, voxel size, etc.).
radius:expansion radius that can be applied to the contour to include voxels that are only partially inside the contour.
map_points_to_voxels:
 boolean value. If True, contour points are mapped to the nearest mask voxel coordinates before generating the path.
Returns:
mask object with weighted edge voxels
get_mask(template=None, size=None, spacing=None, radius=0.0, map_points_to_voxels=False)¶

Get the binary mask for the roi.

Keyword arguments:
template:image template can be used to specify image meta-data (image size, voxel size, etc.).
radius:expansion radius that can be applied to the contour to include voxels that are only partially inside the contour.
map_points_to_voxels:
 boolean value. If True, contour points are mapped to the nearest mask voxel coordinates before generating the path.
get_mask_edge_voxels(exclude_z=False)¶

Return a boolean image where 1’s indicate that a voxel is on the mask boundary

get_mask_information(size=None, spacing=None)¶

Compute the origin, size, and shape of the binary mask for the current ROI.

get_mask_volume(edge_voxel_weight=None)¶

Compute the ROI volume from the binary mask

Keyword arguments:
edge_voxel_weight:
 weight assigned to the voxels on the surface of the mask
get_slice_thickness()¶

Compute the smallest gap between adjacent contour planes.

Returns:
  • Minimum spacing between slices
  • 0 if only one contour plane exists for the current ROI
  • None if the ROI has no contours
get_volume()¶

Compute the volume for the current ROI

interpolate_contour_at_voxel_edges(cntr, mask)¶

Interpolate the current contour points at mask voxel edges.

Positional arguments:
cntr:contour object
mask:mask object
load_binary_mask(file, dimX=None, dimY=None, dimZ=None)¶

Load an ROI binary mask from a file

Positional arguments:
file:file to open
Keyword arguments:
dimX:length in the X dimension
dimY:length in the Y dimension
dimZ:length in the Z dimension
run_length_decode(runlength, dimZYX)¶

Decode a string into an ROI object

Positional arguments:
runlength:run-length-encoded string
dimZYX:list of dimensions in Z, Y, and X
Returns
roi instance of the binary mask representation
run_length_encode()¶
Returns:
run-length-encoded string representation of the ROI binary mask

Mask¶

The mask class is a subclass of image. See the full documentation of the image class for more details.

class data_elements.image.Mask(dim=3)¶

The mask class adds functions to the image class that specifically relate to binary masks.

bounds¶

Get the upper and lower bounds of the binary mask

Returns:
tuple of numpy arrays (lower bound, upper bound) of the nonzero elements of the mask
get_mask_edge_voxels(exclude_z=False)¶

Get all voxels on the edge of the mask.

get_volume(edge_voxel_weight=None)¶

Compute the ROI volume from the binary mask

Keyword arguments:
edge_voxel_weight:
 weight assigned to edge voxels when computing volume
Returns:
volume of the binary mask
load(infile, dimX=None, dimY=None, dimZ=None)¶

Load a binary mask from a file

Positional arguments:
infile:file to open
Keyword arguments:
dimX:length in the X dimension
dimY:length in the Y dimension
dimZ:length in the Z dimension
lower_bound¶

Get the lower bound of the binary mask.

Returns:
numpy array of lower bound of the nonzero elements of the mask
run_length_encode()¶
Return:
run-length-encoded string representation of the ROI binary mask
set_data_with_indices(points)¶

Construct a new mask using a list of points corresponding to voxels in the mask.

Positional arguments:
points:list of (x,y,z) indices that correspond to voxels in the mask
upper_bound¶

Get the upper bound of the binary mask.

Returns:
numpy array of upper bound of the nonzero elements of the mask

Dose¶

Dose-related metadata and routines designed to mimic the Insight Toolkit. Inherits from the ‘Image’ class and provides additional parameters and methods specific to dose grids.

class data_elements.dose.Dose(dose_grid=None, dose_scaling_factor=1.0)¶

The dose class is a representation of the dose grid and all associated metadata.

Keyword arguments:
dose_grid:numpy array storing dose information
dose_scaling_factor:
 scaling factor for dose values
copy_information(img)¶

Copy image information from the input image instance

Positional arguments:
img:dose object
get_dose()¶

Get the dose grid.

Returns:
numpy array of dose data per voxel
get_dose_points(points)¶

Look up the list of points in the dose grid.

Positional arguments:
points:list of (x,y,z) index of pixel to be updated
Note:
The input index should be specified as [X,Y,Z].
Returns:
List of Values of the given pixels
get_pixel(idx)¶

Get a pixel from the image data buffer.

Positional arguments:
idx:(x,y,z) index of pixel to be read
Note:
The input index should be specified as [X,Y,Z]. This will update data, which is indexed [Z,Y,X].
Returns:
Value of selected pixel
get_slice(slice_idx)¶

Returns a 2D slice from a 3D image.

Positional arguments:
slice_idx:index of the slice to return
Returns:
2-D image object of the selected slice
interpolate_pixel(continuous_idx)¶

Get a pixel from the current image. This function allows the image to be interpolated via tri-linear interpolation.

Positional arguments:
continuous_idx:(x,y,z) index of pixel to be read
Note:
The input index should be specified as [X,Y,Z]. This will update data, which is indexed [Z,Y,X].
Returns:
Value of selected interpolated pixel
interpolate_slice(*args)¶

Get a slice from the current image.

Input argument(s) should be one of the following:
  • 1 input: An Nx1 list of continuous slice (z) indices
  • 3 inputs: ix, iy, iz
    Note:
    ix and iy specify the indices in the x-y plane to be included in the interpolation. iz is the list of continuous slice (z) indices
max¶

Get the max dose.

mean¶

Get the mean dose.

min¶

Get the min dose.

set_dose(dose_grid, dose_scaling_factor=1.0)¶

Set the dose grid. Input is converted to a numpy array

Positional arguments:
dose_grid:dose grid representing dose per voxel
Keyword arguments:
dose_scaling_factor:
 scaling factor for dose values
set_pixel(idx, value)¶

Set a pixel in the image data buffer.

Positional arguments:
idx:(x,y,z) index of pixel to be updated
value:value to assign to the given voxel
Note:
The input index should be specified as [X,Y,Z]. This will update data, which is indexed [Z,Y,X].
std¶

Get the standard deviation of the dose.

Dose Mask¶

Module to facilitate dose mapping from dose grid to mask

class data_elements.dose_map.DoseMask(msk, dsg, dim=3)¶

The DoseMask class is an extension of the mask class.

Instead of a binary mask, this class is a mask where nonzero values correspond to the administered to that voxel. Calculations are performed on construction so self.data reflects dose values in the range of the mask.

Positional arguments:
msk:mask object to map dose onto
dsg:dose grid
compute_dose_mask()¶

Compute a dose mask using the class’ roi and dose variables.

Returns:
List of dose values corresponding to each nonzero index in the mask
compute_dvh(edge_voxel_weight=1.0, bins=200)¶

Compute a DVH curve for the given ROI from the given dose grid.

Keyword arguments:
mask:mask over which to compute the DVH
edge_voxel_weight:
 weight given to voxels on the surface of the mask
bins:number of bins to use, or an array of bin edges
Returns:
List of tuples of the DVH data.
get_dose_to_volume(v)¶

Get the dose delivered to v percent of the volume.

Keyword arguments:
v:fraction of the volume (from 0 to 1)
Returns:
dose:dose delivered to specified volume in cGy
get_volume_with_dose(d)¶

Get the dose delivered to v percent of the volume.

Keyword arguments:
d:dose value
Returns:
v:fraction of volume receiving specified dose
map_points(dosePts)¶

Map dose values onto the mask. Changes are reflected in self.data

Positional arguments:
dosePts:List of dose values corresponding to each nonzero index in the mask

Dose Volume Histogram (DVH)¶

class data_elements.dvh.Dvh(data=None, roi=None, mask=None, dose=None)¶

Dose Volume Histogram representation.

Initialize the DVH class with either the data or both a structure and dose class.

Keyword arguments:
data:points defining a dose volume histogram
roi:Roi class
mask:Mask class
dose:Dose class
compute_dose_mask()¶

Compute a dose mask using the DVH class’ roi and dose variables.

Returns:
List of dose values corresponding to each nonzero index in the mask
compute_dvh()¶

Compute a DVH curve for the given ROI from the given dose grid. Returns the DVH data. If no binary mask is specified, one will be computed for the dvh.roi. The value of each voxel contained within the mask is used to weight the dose data in the final histogram. Input parameter “bins” may be specified as an integer number of bins to include in the histogram, or it may be a vector of bin edges (see np.histogram).

If an edge_voxel_weight is specified, all edge voxels in the x-y plane of the binary mask are multipled by the specified weight.

estimate_mean()¶

Estimate the mean dose from the differential DVH

Returns:
Mean dose
get_cumulative_dose(normalized=None)¶

Convert dose bin widths to cumulative dose points

Returns:
Cumulative dose data bins
get_cumulative_volume()¶

Convert differential volume bins to cumulative volume bins

Returns:
Cumulative volume data bins
get_differential_dose(normalized=None)¶

Convert cumulative dose points to dose bin widths (e.g., DICOM standard)

Returns:
Differential dose data bins
get_differential_dvh()¶

Compute the differential DVH data points

Returns:
List of tuples of differential DVH datapoints
get_differential_volume()¶

Convert cumulative volumes to differential volumes

Returns:
Differential volume data bins
get_dose(type='cum', normalized=False)¶

Get the dose data.

Positional arguments:
type:type of dose to calculate - ‘cum’ for cumulative dose - ‘diff’ for differential dose
Keyword arguments:
normalized:boolean value. If True, normalize all dose values by the maximum dose.
Returns:
Dose data bins from the dvh object
get_dose_to_volume(v)¶

Get the dose delivered to v percent of the volume.

Keyword arguments:
v:fraction of the volume (from 0 to 1)
Returns:
d:dose delivered to specified volume in cGy
get_volume(type, normalized=False)¶

Get the volume data.

Positional arguments:
type:type of dose to calculate - ‘cum’ for cumulative dose - ‘diff’ for differential dose
Keyword arguments:
normalized:boolean value. If True, normalize all dose values by the maximum dose.
Returns:
Volume data from the dvh object
get_volume_with_dose(d)¶

Get the dose delivered to v percent of the volume.

Keyword arguments:
d:dose value
Returns:
v:fraction of volume receiving specified dose
set_data(data)¶

Set the DVH data.

Positonal arguments:
data:list of (dose, volume) tuples
